name: Panida Paethanom
intro: Frontend dev student with a passion for UX/UI and clean, responsive design. Full-stack in progress. I thrive on solving challenges, learning new tools, and bringing creative ideas to life. From chef to coder, always learning!
about: I am a final-year Front-End Development student at Noroff School of Technology and Digital Media. After a 10-year career as a chef, working in Michelin-starred restaurants, I decided to pursue my passion for programming and UX/UI design. I love turning ideas into functional, beautiful solutions and believe there’s great potential to digitalize many aspects of the food and kitchen world. Photography is my hobby—a creative skill that complements and enhances my programming journey.

education.details:
Front-end developer - Vocational degree


Noroff School of Technology and Digital Media, Oslo Norway


Gained expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and API integration through hands-on projects, focusing on creating responsive, accessible, and user-friendly web solutions.

Culinary Arts - Hospitality Access Program


Dusit Thani College, Bangkok Thailand


Trained in Western culinary techniques, including food preparation, plating, and kitchen management, with a strong focus on professional hospitality standards.

Computer Program- Vocational degree


Thai Business Administration College, Bangkok Thailand


Studied Pascal programming, basic website development, and video editing, focusing on foundational skills in software development and multimedia production.

experiences.details:
Chef


Fursetgruppen, Oslo Norway


Creating traditional Japanese menu, recipes, food cost, training staff, as well as taking food photography and creating menu graphic and managing social media.

Founder - Food Catering Service


Kværnerbyen Thaimat, Oslo Norway


Started a small food delivery business while adapting to life in Norway after relocating from Thailand. Took orders via Facebook and personally delivered them on foot, providing authentic Thai cuisine locally.

Founder - Burger and Craft Beer Restaurant


Bad Burger, Bangkok Thailand


Opened a burger and craft beer joint in Bangkok, recognized as one of the top 10 burger spots in the city, delivering quality food, unique vibe, and a vibrant dining experience.

Chef - Michelin-starred Restaurant


L’Atelier de Joel Robuchon, Bangkok Thailand


Specialized in preparing high-quality cold dishes, salads, and appetizers, maintaining the precision and excellence synonymous with a Michelin-starred restaurant.

Chef - 5 Star Hotel


Grand Hyatt Erawan, Bangkok Thailand


Specialized in classical European cuisine, crafting elegant dishes with precision and creativity while upholding the luxury standards of a world-renowned five-star hotel.
